website_summaries.verdict: As a $99 content-streaming set-top box, OnLive's MicroConsole offers an intriguing low-cost alternative to traditional living-room game consoles--if you have enough bandwidth.
pros: includes cables, controller, and a free game
cons: bundled controller feels sluggish at times

customer_reviews.title: Out of date
customer_reviews.text: Well I just found out you can't use this thing but the controller you can use if you have an converter to convert the controls on the controller. The system itself is out of business and not fit sure or if it will come back in business. But I'm keeping mine just in case out does. And the controller is crazy good. Feels amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Gavino Alaniz

customer_reviews.title: Game streaming does work!!
customer_reviews.text: Suprised me works really well no lag playing fast paced games top graphics..just needs more top game support .i have comcast blast and theres no lag...it will suprise you.!!!.they are working with steam now so olives library of steam games can be played once purchased through onlive or steam..i get them cheaper through steam sales..but also amazing is you dont need a computer or hard drive space.

customer_reviews.title: Obsolete
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. Sony purchased OnLive's patents and is shutting down the service on April 30th, 2015. All of this hardware will be obsolete and work with nothing.
customer_reviews.author: George Pappals

customer_reviews.title: !!! WARNING !!!
customer_reviews.text: ONLIVE HAS BEEN SHUT DOWN. This is completely useless now that Sony bought the patents. If you can do something with the parts on the other hand, more power to you. I'm giving five stars to the product as it was before. Being able to stream games from anywhere with an okay connection was awesome! I really hope that another service like OnLive comes around again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wheeler Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Onlive.com cloud gaming
customer_reviews.text: Onlive.com sells its console for $99 just so everybody interested in this knows. Its a free cloud gaming program, 7mb in size application for your PC or laptop. You can stream video games (small library atm but decent) its very cool. 100% free to sign up and trial their games. Try it, but dont spend over $100 on the console. =p
customer_reviews.author: Germality

customer_reviews.title: Great idea that ultimately failed due to lack of interest.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the OnLive gaming service.However it saddens me to say that the company has shutdown their servers unable to retain the revenue required to keep this wonderful service alive.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Jones

customer_reviews.title: Blown away
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic graphics on this mini-system. I was concerned that the graphics might not be as good as the PS3, but they are flawless. Make sure you've got a good enough internet connection to make it work. Very slick system.
customer_reviews.author: Theocritus

product_meta.title: OnLive Game System
product_meta.description: The OnLive gaming console allows you to use the OnLive online gaming service on your TV. Comes with 1 wireless controller, and all the necessary cables.
feature_bullets: Includes wireless controller, rechargeable battery, power adapter, HDMI cable, Ethernet cable, USB Cable, 2 AA batteries
Tune in to the games you love, instantly, with the OnLive Game System for TV.
Play top-tier video games on demand, watch live gameplay free anytime you want and even record Brag Clip videos, all with the touch of a button.
With the OnLive Game System, changing games is as easy as changing channels, so all your time is game time.
